intro: Galium aschenbornii, commonly known as the Aschenborn's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, slender, often hairy leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters. It blooms from late spring to early summer, and its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
